physical.addressPart: Room G31 Chemical Sciences Bldg F10 University of NSW Kensington NSW 2052

service.description:
The RM1000 uses a microscope to focus a 780nm laser onto a sample and the scattered light passes through a Raman spectrometer. The 50x microscope objective on the 1000RM enables the 780nm laser spot to be focused to a smaller spot than is possible with the 785nm laser on the RamanStation. We recommend the RM1000 when you need to measure features smaller than 100micron on the sample surface
Excitation source: 780nm (infrared) laser. Microscope objectives available: 5x, 10x, and 50x, plus 20x long working distance. Manual stage only (mapping not available). Samples include organic compounds and polymers with chromophores exhibiting fluorescence.
